intro: Ardisia cagayanensis, commonly known as the Cagayan evergreen or Cagayan starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Ardisia cagayanensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
